en.am_p: I'm a programmer specialized in game development.
en.am_p2: I'm from Madrid, Spain. I've a degree in Videogame Development, a 4-year programming degree at Universidad Complutense de Madrid.I've developed some projects in groups of 6-10 people so I know how to work in team. The languages that I've used the most are C++, C# and Java, but I also know Java, Python, C, Lua and Javascript.Unity is the engine that I feel more comfortable, nevertheless I also have used Unreal.I have projects for PC, Android and PS4, as well as multiplatform, multiplayer and VR.
en.am_p3: Other things I like to do outside of programming are enjoying time with my friends playing videogames or going out, spending time with my cats and dog and playing floorball, a sport that I play since I was 6.
en.sk_p: The program languages that I've mainly used are C++ and C#, but I also used Java, Python, Javascript, LUA and C.About video game engines, I've used Unity for 4 years, and Unreal I know the basic.Some of my skill that I learn and use during my collegue time are this:
en.sk_0: Experience developing video games in teams of 10
en.sk_1: Use of GIT as a version control system
en.sk_3: Desing of applications based on data
en.sk_6: VR games development in Unity and Unreal
en.sk_7: Console and Android video games development
en.sk_9: Algorithms, types and structures in problem solving
en.pr0_title: Procedural generation of ecosystems, and evolution of living beings
en.pr0_p:
BSC developed by a team of 6. It's the development of a tool based on data that creates an environment and creatures that adapt, interact and evolve within the biome. The project contains multiple techniques, such as terrain generation, artificial intelligence, pathfindig and evolutionary programming.The project also contains a telemetry system and data visualization and analysis tools made for the evaluation of the program.It also has a simulation in Unity where it's possible to see the different environments and creatures with their features and interactions with the environment.
The most remarkable is:
en.pr0_comp0: Continuous development using Scrum and Pivotal to reach the goals
en.pr0_comp1: Design and implementation of the tool's software structure
en.pr0_comp2: Implementation of the bases and the creature's logic behaviour itself
en.pr0_comp3: Design and implementation of the telemtry system and data's analysis and visualization
en.pr0_comp4: Use of an external environment (Unity) to show an example of tool usage
en.pr1_p:
Develop of the app Flow Free, a mobile game. It's programmed in Unity. It contains the regular levels (Intro, Manias and Rectangles)
The most remarkable is:
en.pr1_comp0: It follows a multiplatform architecture, being able to play in PC and Android
en.pr1_comp1: Data persistence system, with anti hack check using a hash map
en.pr1_comp2: Include Unity ads (banners, intersitital and rewarded)
en.pr11_p:
Develop of the app Oh-nO, a mobile game. It's programmed in Android Studio using Java (Swing). 
The most remarkable is:
en.pr11_comp0: Development of the engine using Java Swing and multithreading
en.pr11_comp1: It follows a multiplatform architecture, being able to play in PC and Android
en.pr2_p:
Game engine made from 0, developed using C++ and different technology engines.Ogre for render, Bullet for physics, FMOD for sound, CEGUI for UI; SDL Library for handle the input and LUA as scripting language.It's a based on data engine. It uses LUA files to define scenes and prefabs. Ogravity and Ogrecabezas were made using this engine
The most remarkable is:
en.pr2_comp0: Coupling of the different technology engines
en.pr2_comp3: Two different types of games with the engine
en.pr2_comp4: Scrum and Pivotal Tracker during the develop process
en.pr3_p:
A copy of Wolfenstein 3D (1992) maps and movement. Developed using C++ for PC and PS4.The source code only include the PC code due to a NDA.
The most remarkable is:
en.pr3_comp1: Multithreading architecture. Two threads (render and logic) communicating by a concurrent queue
en.pr3_comp2: PS4 memory and render buffer management. Using the CPU for render in PS4 and GPU in PC
en.pr3_comp3: Simulation of a 3D world using raycast algorithm in a 2D world<.
en.pr4_p:
Develop of a network system using C++ with SDL2, available only in Linux.This application is a spanish card game called Tute.When 4 users enter to the same server, then the game starts. 
The most remarkable is:
en.pr4_comp0: A client-server architecture. The server handles the game state and notifies to the clients
en.pr4_comp2: Handle the conexion/desconexion of the players
en.pr5_p:
Fighter-Traighter is a 2D fighting game programmed with C++, using SDL2 for input and Box2D for physics. The player can play vs an AI or play a 1 vs 1 with a friend. At the beginning the player has to select the character to use during the fight.Each round starts in a training phase, where the players try to win it (two differents modes).The player who wins can choose 2 of 3 abilities. Then, each player select two abilities of all unlocked to use during the figth. And finally the fight, where each player try to beat the opponent using the attacks of the selected character and the abilities previously picked. 
The most remarkable is:
en.pr5_comp0: Box2D library coupling and implementation of the physics system with it
en.pr5_comp3: Input management with SDL2. Possibility to modify controls in game
en.pr6_p:
This project is developed with Javascript and Phaser framework. It's a 2D platform game. The goal in Nakhevari is get the maximum score, so the player has to reach the bottom of the level as soon as possible, dodging the obstacles, killing the enemies and get the coins. The level is divided by a wall in the middle and the player has to decide in which side stay to reach the bottom.
The most remarkable is:
